column4: I'm on Ubuntu 8.04, and I just used system monitor to check my free HDD space... there is a 5 GB difference between the free and available.. any ideas why?
﻿Dr_Willis_AAO: oh.. didn't know that
sudo tune2fs -m 0 /dev/hda1 or whatever
﻿duffydack: thanx mate
ive always failed to see the point of the 5% reservation of ext3..
guess ive never had an "emergency"
is it like for restore points? what goes into those 5%?
i make sure it wont get full..
its supposed to be for root access, running progs for recovery etc, and as willis says, lost n found..i guess
for me, in the real world its not needed...
set it to 1% or something then.. i
depends how big your / is set to.
I have a 10G partition for /, and another 100G partition for /home... and those 5 missing from /home are annoying me
what mount point is it anyway ?
ah.. well,   set to 0
yeah I was thinking that... don't need much there
the chances it being full and errored to hell, well.. if it were me i`d set to 0
dont come here lookin for me when it all goes ****
﻿Dr_Willis_AAO: kk.. thanx
sudo tune2fs -l /dev/whatever will show its reserved space
among other things
this will help me for now... I guess I should invest in some more storage, probably an external HDD or something
curiousity, a 100g home, what do you have there?  ihad a 160gig external and its JFS...ext3 is too slow at working with 10-20gig files (virtualbox)..and lots of small files too..
lots of anime :)
